<p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading Americas, LLC, Commercial \u002F Trading<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your future plans<\u002Fb><br> An exciting new opportunity opened for an experienced short-term congestion trader to join and become a core part of our US congestion optimisation team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The US congestion trading desk at RWE manages the long- and short-term congestion exposure of our existing renewables portfolio. Our trading activities are focussed around various ISOs across the US (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP, MISO, PJM).<br> Your role is to develop and execute trading strategies in multiple US congestion markets, develop and maintain our pricing models and to deploy trading capital to make profitable decisions. You will be managing, optimizing and maximizing the congestion revenues for our assets in the US. Furthermore, you will closely work with a fast growing team of energy trading professionals from diverse backgrounds.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop, optimize and execute our short-term (day-ahead) congestion trading strategies in various ISO regions (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP &amp; PJM)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyze and formulate opinions about short-term market risks and opportunities to take positions in the Day-ahead market<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Utilize and finetune our quantitative analysis techniques and machine learning approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Applying our fundamental market models to test and derive your trading strategy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Build and maintain relationships with our fundamental market experts and various other experts across the group (e.g. AI modelling experts)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Build-up performance dashboards and automate workflows to streamline our daily trading routine<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b><br> Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> University degree in Mathematics, Economics, (Electrical) Engineering or related field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Profound professional experience in electricity markets (e.g. in a commercial, consulting or similar role)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in managing and analyzing large scale structured and unstructured data using e.g. Python or R, familiar with SQL and data modelling<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Outstanding understanding of commercial dependencies and influencing commercial acumen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrate a self-confident natural behavior and be comfortable to handle uncertain (market) situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent analytical mindset, striving for optimization and performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong team player &amp; <p><b> HR Operations lead<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Human Resource Operations Lead aids with and facilitates the human resource processes. This role administers employee health and welfare plans and acts as liaison between employees and insurance providers. This position resolves benefits-related problems and ensures effective use of plans and positive employee relations. The Human Resource Operations Lead makes that certain plans are administered in accordance with federal and state regulations and that plan provisions are followed. This role provides administrative support to the human resource function as needed, including record-keeping, file maintenance and HRIS entry.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Supervisory Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> None.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Duties\u002FResponsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><b> You are passionate about figures, data and facts and you help the reporting, process and IT landscape.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <li><b> You recognize complex HR-specific data correlations and manage to transfer them into comprehensible Excel evaluations and charts.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Administers health and welfare plans, including enrollments, changes and terminations. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Processes required documents through payroll and insurance providers to ensure accurate record-keeping and proper deductions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Performs customer service functions by answering employee requests and questions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completes Forms customer landscape and the relevant HR stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professional group-wide consulting (national and international) to various departments such as HR Digital, Shared Service Centers and IT Services in the context of Master Data Management and SAP Organizational Management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Training of specialist departments and employees on the use of HR IT systems.<\u002Fli>\n projects in USA.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Maintenance of Project HSE (Health, Safety &amp; Environmental) risk registers in relation to The <b>Senior<\u002Fb> <b>Talent Acquisition Partner<\u002Fb> plays a critical role at RWE Renewables, Americas as the team is often the first point of contact for external Talent. We are currently adding team members to support the business as it grows. Team members will focus on full, life-cycle recruiting, including proactively sourcing talent, screening &amp; interviewing candidates, advising on best practices, negotiating and extending offers. You will work closely with hiring managers to develop recruitment strategies and to support new hiring managers as they move through the interviewing and selection process. You are the subject matter expert in Talent Acquisition, your counsel is of high value. The ideal candidate will have a strong sense of urgency, the ability to build pipelines and develop long-term relationships with candidates and hiring managers, and an interest in process improvement. The market and recruiting needs are always changing. Talent Acquisition Partners are skilled and easily adapt to change. If you have an innate sense of competition, a high-level of professionalism, and want to make an immediate impact, join us as we make a difference in the Renewables space. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>This is a Hybrid work schedule for the Austin office. growth and sustainability of the business. pipeline.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Your Tasks<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Hiring and balancing standardised development roles as needed by project activity in the region <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensuring <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading Americas, LLC, Commercial \u002F Trading<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your future plans<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> An exciting new opportunity opened for an experienced FTR \u002F congestion trader to join and become a core part of our US congestion optimisation team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The US congestion trading desk at RWE manages the long- and short-term congestion exposure of our existing 4.1 GW renewables portfolio. Our trading activities are centred around various ISOs across the US (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP, MISO, PJM). You will collaborate with an enthusiastic and fast growing team of energy trading professionals with diverse backgrounds.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role is to develop and execute trading strategies in multiple US congestion markets, research and model market fundamentals and to deploy trading capital to make profitable decisions. Furthermore, you will be managing, optimizing and maximizing the congestion revenues for our assets in the US.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop, optimize and execute congestion trading strategies and participate in FTR auctions for the mid- and long-term in multiple ISO regions (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP &amp; PJM)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analyze and formulate opinions about changing market fundamentals to identify market opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Optimize market channels to hedge congestion risk e.g. via auction, screen or OTC<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Utilize fundamental market models to derive price views and trading strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Build and maintain relationships with our fundamental market modelling teams and various other experts across the group (e.g. asset developers) to verify your price views<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> University degree in Mathematics, Economics, (Electrical) Engineering, Finance, Statistics or related field<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Profound professional experience in electricity markets (e.g. in a commercial, consulting or similar role)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thorough understanding and experience in power market models (e.g. DAYZER, UPLAN, Promod, GE Maps, Plexos, Aurora)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong ability to manage and analyze large scale structured and unstructured data using e.g. Python or R, familiar with SQL and data modelling is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent understanding of commercial dependencies and influencing commercial acumen<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A willingness to be extremely detail oriented in reviewing the market fundamentals of the markets and the results of the predictive models and quantitative analysis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrate a self-confident natural behavior and be comfortable to handle uncertain (market) situations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent analytical mindset, striving for optimization and performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong team player &amp; excellent communicator with a high degree of personal commitment, motivation and the ability to work independently<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Benefits you can rely on<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Join an international leading energy trading house which is in a period of growth<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Find yourself in a motivating workplace that is built on mutual trust, values and a feedback culture with a positive and inspiring working atmosphere<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Discretionary bonus based on execution performance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vivant team work, support and openness, visibility and recognition of own work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Relocation package available<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79798<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? position<\u002Fb>: Supervise the overall operations and maintenance of one solar farm and all related facilities to assure safety and maximize availability in accordance with Operations mission: to improve safety, increase the knowledge and technical capability of our people, increase production, reduce O&amp;M costs, and to standardize processes globally.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Essential Pass physical fitness tests required for the company.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lift, carry, and transport essential equipment, tools, and materials to job site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure operations is in compliance with contracted requirements and performance targets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all maintenance activities, including those performed during scheduled outages and overhauls, are accurately recorded and documented to identify the failure history, mean time between failures and root causes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervise, train and motivate personnel assigned to his\u002Fher solar farm.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare the annual site O&amp;M budget and recommend capital improvements\u002Fenhancements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervise the activities of the O&amp;M Contractor to ensure general public, where required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occasional travel required for training, offsite meetings, and support of other solar farms where required.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Work from an accredited school, other than correspondence or on-line, in Business or a technical hard science (engineering, physics, power, or closely similar) may substitute for 2 years of experience. plans<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> An exciting new opportunity opened for an experienced FTR \u002F congestion trader to join and become a core part of our US congestion optimisation team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The US congestion trading desk at RWE manages the long- and short-term congestion exposure of our existing 4.1 GW renewables portfolio. Our trading activities are centred around various ISOs across the US (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP, MISO, PJM). You will collaborate with an enthusiastic and fast growing team of energy trading professionals with diverse backgrounds.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role is to develop and execute trading strategies in multiple US congestion markets, research and model market fundamentals and to deploy trading capital to make profitable decisions. Furthermore, you will be managing, optimizing and maximizing the congestion revenues for our assets in the US.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop, optimize and execute congestion trading strategies and participate in FTR auctions for the mid- and long-term in multiple ISO regions (e.g. ERCOT, NYISO, SPP &amp; <p><b>RWE Renewables Americas LLC<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Structured Finance team is responsible for raising external project financing, primarily tax equity financing, for utility-scale renewable energy projects as a key contributor to RWE's growth and financial objectives. The Structured Finance team works closely with investors, third-party consultants, and internal business teams to efficiently execute financing transactions and support RWE's strategic objectives. The ideal candidate has experience in complex financing modeling in the renewable energy sector. This problem-solving mindset can efficiently manage multiple priorities and keeps the \"big picture\" of RWE's best interests in mind.<\u002Fp>\n <p> KEY RESPONSIBILITIES &amp; PURPOSE OF POSITION<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead valuation modeling for tax equity transactions and other financing arrangements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate various workstreams necessary to successfully execute financing transactions, including diligence management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide support to senior deal members in deal structuring and negotiating deal documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide coaching and development to Analysts and Senior Analysts in the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work collaboratively across RWE business teams related to financial modeling and transaction execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish and maintain effective working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicate effectively with Structured Finance team colleagues, internal business teams, and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare internal and external presentation materials<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist other parts of the finance team as required, including quality control reviews and gate process support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recommend and lead process improvement initiatives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist with various internal ad hoc project<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS &amp; QUALIFICATION<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> 5+ years of experience overall in a role with an emphasis on maintaining financial models and investment presentations (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent Microsoft Excel &amp; PowerPoint skills, with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel formulas and model creation (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledgeable of renewable energy project economics (specifically wind, solar, or storage) and related incentive systems (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience modeling tax equity partnership flip structures or similar project finance modeling (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to apply creative thinking to solve complex, interrelated problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player with the flexibility to work both independently and in cross-functional teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective communicator with strong written and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor's Degree (required) with a background in business, finance, accounting, tax, or an analytical\u002Fquantitative field preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> MBA, CFA, or similar postgraduate Degree is considered a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79018, <\u002Fb>application deadline<b> <\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? position of Revenue Analyst. The successful candidate will also be expected to become an expert in energy accounting and analysis with emphasis on Power Purchase Agreements while acting as a resource to other departments within the Company. <p><b>RWE Renewables Americas LLC<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Austin, Boston, Chicago<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, <\u002Fb><b>Full time<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Functional area:<\u002Fb> Commercial \u002F Trading<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Remuneration:<\u002Fb> Exempt<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Purpose:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Energy and electricity markets are rapidly changing with the deployment of intermittent renewables and energy storage. Our team of analysts forecasts the impact of these changes on energy and electricity prices with a focus on Europe and selected US markets with the goal of reducing uncertainty for decision makers. To improve and expand our modelling scope, we are looking for a US Power Market Modelling Analyst. You will incorporate fundamental price drivers such as fuel commodity prices, regulatory changes, and conventional and renewables capacity development into a production cost model and quantify the impact of these drivers on wholesale electricity prices. You will improve and expand our forecasts, perform model runs, check model plausibility, and back-test model results. You will communicate and explain your findings directly to our main stakeholders such as commercial analysis, strategy, regulatory affairs, controlling and finance to support portfolio decisions, lobbying activities and financial planning. Modelling focus for this position is PJM\u002FNYISO but knowledge on other US electricity markets such as MISO and\u002For CAISO is also advantageous. You will need to understand and market-specific design elements such as price formation, capacity auctions, and co-optimization of energy and reserves.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Job Descriptions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Analyse relevant fundamental drivers (existing grid and line capacity and availability, technical gird parameters, residual load, interconnection capacity, regulatory changes, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Compile time series for all relevant power model inputs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work together with commercial functions to collect the best available knowledge<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Transfer market design into model logic<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Model calibration &amp; backtesting<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform model runs and develop model scenarios incl. stochastic model development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Automate model input updates and model result processing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interpret model results to provide decision-oriented consulting services to support portfolio decisions, lobbying and financial planning<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand and evaluate external studies and forecasts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deliver long term market view for strategic projects and general valuations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> University Degree in Engineering, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent. An advanced degree with an electricity market focus is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong conceptual understanding electricity market concepts such as security-constrained economic dispatch and unit-commitment, nodal\u002Fzonal price formation, capacity auctions, co-optimization of energy and reserves, â€œmissing money,â€ and levelized cost of electricity.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professional experience at an ISO, RTO, or in a consulting role with an electricity market focus is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in fundamental modelling, particularly production cost modelling for electricity markets. Experience with production modelling tools such as PLEXOS, AURORA, PROMOD, UPLAN, or similar or mathematical programming languages like GAMS is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very strong quantitative and analytical skills (transfer of algorithms into model conduct)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to transfer knowledge between analysis and decision makers in other departments with an interdisciplinary approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent IT skills inc. ability to model in main languages as Python and in the MS Windows environment (particularly Excel, Access)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience interfacing with databases (SQL, R)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Language skills: fluent in English, other European languages are advantageous<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very good team player, high level of self-motivation and flexibility, ability to work in a competitive environment and to meet tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79556, <\u002Fb>application deadline<b> <\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? <p><b>RWE Renewables Americas LLC<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Boston<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible <\u002Fb><b>Full time<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Functional area:<\u002Fb> Engineering<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Remuneration:<\u002Fb> Exempt<\u002Fp>\n <p> As a<b> Senior<\u002Fb> <b>Resource Analyst<\u002Fb> within the Resource Offshore team you will be providing your technical guidance and expertise in wind resource assessment and energy yield modelling to all offshore projects within our global pipeline. You will be participating and representing the company in external expert groups as well as in international R&amp;D\u002Finnovation projects with the aim to maximize the value of those activities. Furthermore, lead of technical due diligence on new opportunities, detailed analysis of specific wind conditions, design and approval of measurement campaigns, design and optimization of turbine layouts, post-construction EPE analysis, power curve measurements as well as management of internal and external stakeholders are other examples of your diverse task landscape that you will face in the daily business. Development and mentoring of our Junior\u002FMedior Analysts is also expected to ensure consistent development of our talents.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Provision of technical expertise as a Senior Resource Analyst throughout the complete lifecycle of offshore wind farm projects from â€œGreenfieldâ€ through BID and FID. You are the technical authority in your area of expertise.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Independent analysis of potential wind energy via in-depth analysis of meteorological raw data from various type of devices and\u002For other available data up to the translation and statistical adjustment into a predicted long-term wind resource by applying industries best practices and latest science. You know the science and cutting edge methodologies like the back of your hand.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Modelling of wind flow and energy yield production estimates via multiple engineering-based wake models including the quantification of various technical losses, inherent uncertainties and identification of discipline-specific risks and opportunities. You have an impressive track record.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead in the design and optimization of turbine layouts and the optimization of projects towards LCoE. You have tackled multiple technical challenges and you know the future trends.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conducting â€œtechnicalâ€ due diligence analysis with regards to wind resource, energy yield, turbine layout, site conditions and proposed wind turbines.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Approval of the design of new and review of existing measurement campaigns based on various type of measurements systems (for e.g. met mast, LiDAR, Floating LiDAR, nacelle mounted LiDAR) as well as review of and independent analysis of results from power curve measurements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support of internal and external discipline-specific R&amp;D projects as well as management and independent analysis of 3rd party assessments. You have a R&amp;D mentality and you have multiple examples in which you developed technical solutions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Continuous improvement of existing in-house standards, industries â€žbest practicesâ€œ and in-house software tools used for various tasks. You never stop, you understand that Offshore is the driver for innovation and that continuous improvement is necessary in all areas.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b> Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Masters or Diploma degree(s) in Meteorology, Aeronautics or Astronautics, Mathematics, Natural Sciences or Engineering.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, key cutting-edge knowledge, a solid and proven track record in wind resource assessment , project design and modeling of wind farm energy production according to best practices and applying the latest science and R&amp;D. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Solid experiences in wind turbine layout design\u002Foptimization, site conditions assessments, load assessments and\u002For power curve measurements is a plus. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Very good knowledge and impressive experience in using relevant wind resource analysis tools (e.g. WindPro, OpenWind, WindoGrapher) relevant statistical analysis as well as wake models. You know the science.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reasonable knowledge and understanding of wind turbine technology (e.g. aerodynamics, turbine control, SCADA system) as well as offshore wind farm system design (e.g. electrical infrastructure) is an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of and experience in programming languages (e.g. Matlab, Python) is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Agile mindset and working attitude, analytical skills, creativity and problem-solving competence is desired.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reasonable level of self-organization, self-reliance, reliability, persistence and organizational skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Excellent communication and team skills as well as a confident appearance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good written and spoken knowledge in English, knowledge of position of Revenue Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for the accounting of wholesale energy sales, preparation of journal entries and analysis associated with these activities. The successful candidate will also be expected to become an expert in energy accounting and analysis with emphasis on Power Purchase Agreements while acting as a resource to other departments within the Company. <p><b>RWE Renewables Americas LLC<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Structured Finance team is responsible for raising external project financing, primarily tax equity financing, for utility-scale renewable energy projects as a key contributor to RWE's growth and financial objectives. The Structured Finance team works closely with investors, third-party consultants, and internal business teams to efficiently execute financing transactions and support RWE's strategic objectives. The ideal candidate has experience in complex financing modeling in the renewable energy sector. This problem-solving mindset can efficiently manage multiple priorities and keeps the \"big picture\" of RWE's best interests in mind.<\u002Fp>\n <p> KEY RESPONSIBILITIES &amp; PURPOSE OF POSITION<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead valuation modeling for tax equity transactions and other financing arrangements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate various workstreams necessary to successfully execute financing transactions, including diligence management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide support to senior deal members in deal structuring and negotiating deal documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide coaching and development to Analysts and Senior Analysts in the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work collaboratively across RWE business teams related to financial modeling and transaction execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish and maintain effective working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicate effectively with Structured Finance team colleagues, internal business teams, and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare internal and external presentation materials<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist other parts of the finance team as required, including quality control reviews and gate process support<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recommend and lead process improvement initiatives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist with various internal ad hoc project<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS &amp; PowerPoint skills, with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel formulas and model creation (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledgeable of renewable energy project economics (specifically wind, solar, or storage) and related incentive systems (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience modeling tax equity partnership flip structures or similar project finance modeling (required)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Ability to apply creative thinking to solve complex, interrelated problems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team player with the flexibility to work both independently and in cross-functional teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective communicator with strong written and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor's Degree (required) with a background in business, finance, accounting, tax, or an analytical\u002Fquantitative field preferred.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> MBA, CFA, or similar postgraduate Degree is considered a plus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79018, <\u002Fb>application deadline<b> <\u002Fb>.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? for projects around the world. <\u002Fp>\n <p>RWE strongly supports personal growth and professional development through project experience, collaboration and formal training.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Areas <p>RWE Renewables Americas LLC, Chicago, United States (US)<\u002Fp>\n <p> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Functional area: Renewables; Finance \u002F Controlling<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Controller (FP&amp;A Analyst)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Job responsibilities<\u002Fb><b>:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> At RWE Renewables Americas, the Controlling Americas team is responsible for financial performance controlling, planning &amp; reporting, portfolio analyses and target setting for the Onshore Wind, Solar and Energy Storage businesses. Working as a strategic partner and trusted advisor with the business, Controlling evaluates improvement measures, actively gives recommendations \u002F appropriate challenge, and business decision support. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a Controller (FP&amp;A Analyst) in the Controlling Americas team, primary responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> This analyst role has three primary areas of focus:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management Support Function Controlling:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support timely, complete, accurate, high-quality reporting \u002F planning \u002F forecasting for the business overhead functions (e.g. HR, Legal, Procurement, Accounting, Senior Management, Controlling, Engineering, Construction, External Affairs, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform KPI analysis and recommend actions to Senior Management. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Identify cost savings opportunities, support business initiatives and ad-hoc analyses. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>High-level of interaction with Head of each Management Support Function.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HR Controlling:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support timely, complete, accurate, high-quality reporting \u002F planning \u002F forecasting of full time employee headcount and personnel expenses for the entire company. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Create and analyse standard set of full time employee and personnel cost performance KPIs; track and analyze value capture activities related to HR.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain FTE position plan status across the company, ensuring accuracy and reflecting any impacts from organizational changes. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Interface with HR and Payroll functions to ensure requirements for internal\u002Fexternal reporting are fulfilled.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High-level of Senior Management exposure and interaction with HR function.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Special Projects:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support a variety of mid\u002Flong-term special projects across the business, as required by Senior Management and the Board, to help drive decision-making. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Some special project examples include, but are not limited to: 10-year strategic growth plan financial model, project lifetime profitability analyses, business case support, asset and goodwill impairment testing, process improvement initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support cross-functional topics across the Controlling group.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High-level of Senior Management and Board exposure due to the nature of special projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination and teamwork: As a primary contact within the Controlling Americas (FP&amp;A) team, coordinate overarching topics and related financial impacts across the business. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Management communication: Prepare materials for and support meetings with Senior Management and the Board for both regular reporting activities and special projects\u002Ftopics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous process improvement: Support proactive pursuit of best practices, processes, standardization and tools that drive gains in efficiency, automation, and quality. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ongoing initiatives: Support company-wide top priorities and goals, special projects, and integration activities team is responsible for financial performance controlling, planning &amp; reporting, portfolio analyses and target setting for the Onshore Wind, Solar and Energy Storage businesses. Working as a strategic partner and trusted advisor with the business, Controlling evaluates improvement measures, actively gives recommendations \u002F appropriate challenge, and business decision support. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As a Controller (FP&amp;A Analyst) in the Controlling Americas team, primary responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> This analyst role has three primary areas of focus:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management Support Function Controlling:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support timely, complete, accurate, high-quality reporting \u002F planning \u002F forecasting for the business overhead functions (e.g. HR, Legal, Procurement, Accounting, Senior Management, Controlling, Engineering, Construction, External Affairs, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform KPI analysis and recommend actions to Senior Management. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Identify cost savings opportunities, support business initiatives and ad-hoc analyses. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>High-level of interaction with Head of each Management Support Function.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HR Controlling:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support timely, complete, accurate, high-quality reporting \u002F planning \u002F forecasting of full time employee headcount and personnel expenses for the entire company. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Create and analyse standard set of full time employee and personnel cost performance KPIs; track and analyze value capture activities related to HR.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain FTE position plan status across the company, ensuring accuracy and reflecting any impacts from organizational changes. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Interface with HR and Payroll functions to ensure requirements for internal\u002Fexternal reporting are fulfilled.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High-level of Senior Management exposure and interaction with HR function.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Special Projects:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support a variety of mid\u002Flong-term special projects across the business, as required by Senior Management and the Board, to help drive decision-making. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Some special project examples include, but are not limited to: 10-year strategic growth plan financial model, project lifetime profitability analyses, business case support, asset and goodwill impairment testing, process improvement initiatives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support cross-functional topics across the Controlling group.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High-level of Senior Management and Board exposure due to the nature of special projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination and teamwork: As a primary contact within the Controlling Americas (FP&amp;A) team, coordinate overarching topics and related financial impacts across the business. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Management communication: Prepare materials for and support meetings with Senior Management and the Board for both regular reporting activities and special projects\u002Ftopics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous process improvement: Support proactive pursuit of best practices, processes, standardization and tools that drive gains in efficiency, automation, and quality. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ongoing initiatives: Support company-wide top priorities and goals, special projects, and integration activities following recent organization structure change, increase in growth targets and implementation of S4 accounting system.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Value enhancement: Support cost savings initiatives, EBITDA enhancement ideas and measurement, and efforts to maximize value.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> People and communication: Support growth and development of the team and how we work together locally and globally.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Qualifications<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Work experience: 2 plus years of professional experience in Controlling, Financial Planning &amp; Analysis, Financial or Management Consulting, or other Finance-related fields; Renewable energy experience is a plus, but not required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Education: BA\u002FBS in Finance\u002FAccounting\u002FEconomics\u002FBusiness (required); Advanced degree is a plus, but not required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to travel: &lt;10%<\u002Fli>\n  <li> is a plus.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Desired traits: Analytical and proactive problem-solver, cross-functional collaboration, continuous process improvement, ability to effectively communicate and interact with Senior Management, experience working in a global organization is a plus, integration and change management experience is a plus, general accounting and IFRS knowledge a plus.<\u002Fli>\n Location somewhat proximate to the projects is also a plus to minimize travel.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your scope of work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Managing the wider Financial team in the project, <p><b>RWE Renewables Americas LLC<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Pooling engineering competencies, driving innovative technical and digital solutions to design and deliver the most cost effective energy storage projects â€“ this is the target of Global Battery Storage Engineering Team at RWE. RWE Renewables and its new subsidiary RWE Battery Solutions are setting up a global centre of competence in the field of energy storage engineering that will support the growth ambition of the entire RWE Group by ensuring energy storage projects of RWE and its customers are designed in the highest quality along the entire life cycle - from the development phase to operation. The global storage engineering hub will benefit from RWE worldwide office locations to attract top talents and support the global ambitions of RWE to become a leader in energy storage.<\u002Fp>\n <p> As Project Manager Integration, you will be a key part of the Battery System Integration Team, leading battery storage projects through execution at an exceptional level of quality, safety, delivering on time and on budget. You will apply your technical and project management expertise while working closely with internal and external stakeholders, contributing to the delivery of energy storage global projects worldwide. Your experience enables you to support and mentor junior members of a diverse team, including talented engineers, project managers and commissioning engineers.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Areas of Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Leading coordination of activities of project engineers and\u002For between project members for large scale, international and complex energy storage projects in the fields of permit, planning, engineering, procurement, controlling, construction, site management, documentation and commissioning through to handover to operations and maintenance team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the work within the subject areas are performed ensuring HSE standards and mentor colleagues in the understanding of the standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Execute budget tracking and contract implementation, creation of forecasts and consideration of time and resource planning for parts of a package for large scale, international and complex energy storage projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare, approve and review tender documents in the subject area (parts of a package), evaluation of tenders and participation in contract negotiations with suppliers and coordinate the execution these agreements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead studies or in sub-projects (packages) on engineering or construction planning and execution as well as approval processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and approve compliance with norms, standards and procedures (best practice) in the area of responsibility<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead lessons learned sessions to ensure improvement of processes and competitiveness of engineering and\u002For project execution<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading studies or parts of a package considering technical and commercial risks including quality assurance<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Leading the communication with internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An energetic, self-starter with excellent interpersonal skills and 4+ years of experience in leading projects, project management or the execution of asset realization projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong passion for decarbonisation and motivation to work in the renewable energy industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong organisational skills, able to meet deadlines and extensive knowledge in the use of Office programs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication skills, fluent in oral and written English.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bachelors and\u002For Masterâ€™s degree in engineering, project management certification is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven experience of leading the execution of utility scale energy storage projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge in the field of network technology, SCADA systems and protocols, balance of plant (relay protection, HVAC, fire suppression, etc.), solar and wind is a plus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sophisticated thinking abilities, incorporating both analytical and
